Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_sample_volume

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_volume establishes the maximum volume level of a 3D sample (the volume to use when the 3D sample is right next to the 3D listener).

void AIL_set_3D_sample_volume(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  S32 volume
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle whose volume is to be set.
volume
is the volume from zero (silence) to 127 (maximum).

Discussion

This function sets the initial volume level for a 3D sound. That is, this is the sound level that will be used when the 3D sound is positioned directly on top of the listener.

Setting the initial volume level is a good way to handle occluded sounds. For example, if you have two sound that are spacially close together, but are separated by two walls, then you can use this function to adjust the relative volume.
